abstract: Two of the central players in the biggest settlement of the financial crisis were once on opposite sides of the negotiating table.
snippet: Two of the central players in the biggest settlement of the financial crisis were once on opposite sides of the negotiating table.
lead_paragraph: At the end of a conference call on the night of Oct. 18, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive and the attorney general left their top lieutenants to hash out the details of a tentative $13 billion settlement. The talks, led Tony West, the associate attorney general at the Justice Department, and Stephen M. Cutler, JPMorgan’s general counsel, could still fall apart over how much wrongdoing the bank will admit on its questionable mortgage practices.

headline.main: Weekend Reading: 2 Key Players in JPMorgan’s $13 Billion Deal

abstract: The Federal Housing Finance Agency,which helped forge a tentative $13 billion settlement with JPMorgan Chase split off with its own deal on Friday, extracting a $4 billion payout from the nation’s biggest bank.
snippet: The Federal Housing Finance Agency,which helped forge a tentative $13 billion settlement with JPMorgan Chase split off with its own deal on Friday, extracting a $4 billion payout from the nation’s biggest bank.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase has secured important concessions in a $13 billion settlement over its mortgage practices, allowances that could ultimately reduce the bank’s financial burden and leave the government itself on the hook for a small portion of the cost.

headline.main: JPMorgan Reaches Deal With Agency Over Loans
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Reaches Deal With Agency Over Loans

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Peter Eavis
